com.iver.cit.gvsig.geoprocess.impl.spatialjoin.fmap
Interface SpatialJoinVisitor

All Superinterfaces:
com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.operations.strategies.FeatureVisitor
All Known Implementing Classes:
IntersectSpatialJoinVisitor, NearestHeuristicSpatialJoinVisitor, NearestSpatialJoinVisitor, SpatiallyIndexedSpatialJoinVisitor
public interface SpatialJoinVisitor
extends com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.operations.strategies.FeatureVisitor

Spatial Join is a geoprocess that tries to relate two layers from its geometry field. To do that it could establish two strategies:

  • Relate a geometry with the nearest geometry of the second layer (1-1 cardinality).
  • Relate a geometry with all the geometries of second layer that verifies a spatial relationship: contained, intersects, etc (1-M cardinality).
SpatialJoinVisitor is a base interface for Visitor that does the process of relationship

Author:
azabala
